caption: Highly recommended pizza place. If you want a healthy version of pizza. this is the place to go.
VERY good gluten free options. Always ask for 1/2 of the amount of cheese to make it a bit more healthy. They sure load up the pies. One of the best GF options in the area!
Always delicious!!
Not bad but quite expensive for what it is. Over $50 bucks for 2 small pizzas and two bottles of water seems steep for “fast food“
Very friendly staff, fast pickup and the best wraps in the city
Looking for a quick bite in downtown and I found Firenza. Common assembly line Pizza joint like Blaze until you realize it's not.
Great local spot! Love the pizzas and salads.

Our pizza was just okay - not bad, but not great. It took a few minutes to get somebody's attention when we sat down. We were in a bit of a hurry to see a show and only after we paid and sat down did they tell us that it would take about 20 minutes. Not ideal.  I'm not going to avoid this place but it isn't a destination either.
Delicious!👍🏾
The pizza here was great. Everything tasted fresh and the staff knows how to treat its guest. Very accommodating and the location (if dining in) is very intimate.

This is a gorgeous restaurant and the perfect place to celebrate a special occasion with a fabulous meal. The tasting menu is incredible! Something g for everyone even if by everything is for you I was with my husband and grown sons and we could not even finish everything . The drinks were also wonderful. Our waiter could not have been any better! He was wonderful d made us feel special and taken care of. This is not inexpensive but totally worth it! If we go back to LA we will go again for sure. Love!
Such cute chic place. Everyone is so nice and helpful. I ordered a small pizza and loved it! So good, will be going back again.
great place for tasty lunch
Great food and good hours. My favorites are the Shrimp lover pizza and the Abigail salad. Very good pasta too. Also good for catering.
Always a delight! I looked for a good pizza spot in LA for like 3 years and finally found it! Love this place!

My mother and I love the food here, as a former employee which I was there when the restaurant open. We came to eat 3 times in one week. It has a major downfall. The A/C was blasting which in part makes you feel so uncomfortable. My mom had to asked to turned it off. They complied but with an attitude. The white lady with long brown hair which I assume was the manager had a very discussed look as if she was doing a favor to us to eat there. She presented herself as bother by our request. On the last time which was Friday August 30. The restaurant was completely empty, very cold again. They turned down the a/c, we were almost finished with our meal and enjoying our coffee when suddenly the Cold air came out blasting, our coffee got cold right away and my mother starting getting sick! The temperature out was below 70! We left the restaurant immediately. My mom which is a famous barber in an Elite barber shop in downtown Chicago and eats in more expensive restaurants swore to never eat here again not to tell her customers who live in the area. She used to tell people about it. Management does not care about customer service. Woman only care about the money we spent there. The restaurant was completely empty on Friday for hours while all the others around had lines outside. What a shame. The only one person who treat us with outmost respect and service was the Black gentlemen, he should work in a better place!!
Love it
Delicious food good service. Cash only tho
It's okay for what it is. Very pricey per topping.
Nice n great food

Food is decent. At the time I went few people were dining in but many came and went for take outs. Waited half an hour because someone kept forgetting making the salad so not impressed by the speed or the service.
Love this joint!¡!
One large pizza is good for 2 persons. The pizza was so good and flavorful.
The food and service is ALWAYS top notch. Better than the Hyde Park location hands down.
Great staff
Great food and fast service.
Delicious
I cant stop getting delivery here. Love the salads, pizza & ohhhh the hummus!

I ordered the Gnocchi alla vodka to go. And it was amazing. My friend ordered the spicy chicken on linguini, which he liked a lot as well. Only problem we had with it was the portion size. We finished our food and was still kinda hungry. We did order takeout but I don't think that would make a difference. I usually order from pasta bowl. Pizza capri was only a dollar or 2 cheaper and half the portion. So if your not too hungry and want really good pasta, go for it. Maybe order an appetizer so you leave satisfied.
Had the farmers sandwich which was fantastic.

I always get the Salad Nicoise and I love it. Good sized piece of salmon, tangy dressing, salty capers and olives, a generous amout of lettuce and tomatoes, and some lovely little pieces of baked potato. You can order at the counter or be served at your table. Sometimes no table ordering if they are busy. Clea, casual look with wood floors.
The best
Fresh options, reasonable prices and FRIENDLY Staff! My neighborhood go to when we need a quick and nutritional bite to eat.
Food was good and service great.  A quaint and relaxing place to go.
Nice place for dinner before theater.  Quick service, good food, nice variety on the menu.
Very reasonable prices for perfectly acceptable food.
Love their salads
Ron & Justin are the best.
Best and inexpensive Italian food pasta pizza
Great as always
Always good
This is the erstwhile zigzag kitchen!!
Good food, terrible parking and you have to go outside and around the corner to use the bathroom. Not fun during the rain or the winter months.
Best pizza in chicago

Woooooo this place is fantastic! Went out with a group of 6 people we had the chicken parmigiana, the baked mostaccioli, and stuffed pizza with sausage and pepperoni. This might be my favorite place for stuffed pizza, the stuffed pizza is lite and sweet. The baked mostaccoili has a bit of a kick but not too over powering and the chicken parmigiana is fantastic, chicken is perfectly cooked and the pasta delicious. Bonus it is BYOB!
Great pizza, fast service.

Absolutely amazing place. Quiet and great food. Great staff. In all of Chicago I haven't yet found d anything quite like this establishment. The BBQ chicken pizza was stupendous. I will be back when back in town. Thank you!
Delicious! I had the turkey sandwich and husband had the BBQ pizza. So good! Quiet little place.

I am from out of town and we were in Chicago and stopped there.  Poor service over cooked calamari and under cooked pizza.  We complained about the pizza and they took 7 dollars off of an 80 dollar bill... By all means avoid this place if you want a good meal.
I love this place! I've been eating Pizza Capri over 20 years.
A steady go to for take out or eat in the area of Steppanwolf. Excellent salads, pizza and sandwiches make this place a staple
Good food, pleasant atmosphere  that for a bargain pre Steppenwolf Theatre dinner.
My favorite pizza in Chicago!
Love this place such good fresh food and lovely staff

Great food, great atmosphere! Has a lovely view of the street and the lady at the counter is absolutely fantastic at what she does! Had their veggie pizza and it was unique yet delicious. Their bruschetta was amazing as well.

WORST EXPERIENCE OF MY LIFE. If I could give 0 stars I would. This was my first time in town and my friends raved about this place so we tried it. The manager (heavyset white guy with receding hairline and sandy curly hair) was curt, rude, and unprofessional. He was extremely rude to my friends and I, before we could even sit down I was ready to leave due to his attitude and disposition. Then as he sat us, he rudely told us that they don't split checks - as if anyone asked him to do so. I will never be back and i will leave this review on every relevant forum possible.
Very good pizza, but average as Chicago pizza goes.

I can confidently say this is one of the best meals I have ever eaten. I ordered the Spinach Ravioli, along with mozzarella sticks and bread. Not only was the food some of the most delicious I have ever eaten, but the atmosphere and service were both superb! I would totally recommend this to anyone looking for a quality experience!
Looks like a run of the mill pizza place but the food is excellent and service is quick.

Right across from Steppenwolf; friendly service and delicious food in reasonable portion sizes. Super convenient to grab a relaxed but swift pre-show dinner. We will definitely be back and would recommend to anyone seeing a show! The seating area is very nice.

My firm ordered from Pizza Capri through the Seamless Care food ordering program for evening meals at the office.   I ordered the Popeye Penne and  slice of cheesecake -- total tab $20, NOT including tax, tip or delivery!  The penne arrived with the sauce dripping all out of the container.  The penne serving was barely enough to put in a coffee cup.  This $12.25 serving took 9 bites to consume and taste rated a "C".  The cheesecake at $7.75 was served plain with no topping or fruit and was a miniature slice of a cake comparable to what is purchased from a vending machine!  This meal barely was worth $8, much less $25.  I have asked Seamless to remove Pizza Capri from the restaurants they use!!  HORRIBLE HORRIBLE HORRIBLE!
Amazing personal service during construction. My family and I loved it. Food had excellent taste and presentation. Everything is freshly made when ordered.
Convenient to get a quick meal before attending a play at Steppenwolf.
Late delivery
I eat here at least once per week the food is amazing and so is the staff. I haven't had a single negative experience since I've started going. Highly recommended if you're craving pasta
Always fresh always consistent.  Been fantastic for over 20 years.
I would give this place negative 5 stars if I could.  The worst pizza I've ever had. If you want to feel like garbage after being treated like garbage, go to pizza Capri.
Great food, loved the people! Had a great chat with the cashiers. Food was great!!
Interesting variety of pizzas, but none are amazing.
Favorite Chicago pizza. Really high quality burgers too.
Good pizza, the place seems well staffed and quick to take and handle the orders.

(Translated by Google) BBQ Chicken Salad was very delicious, a good place, the staff very attentive to the service.  (Original) BBQ Chicken Salad estuvo muy deliciosa, un buen lugar, el staff muy atento al servicio.
Worst pizza ever! It was $18+ and was like a cheap frozen pizza quality.
NEW ambience, upgraded  menu as always great quality food.
Good

I recently visited Pizza Capri in Lincoln Park, and was completely flabbergasted by the customer service. Upon our arrival we were greeted warmly by the guy upfront. We wanted to dine in, and were told we had to pay upfront first which was no problem. So it came time to order drinks they only have cans of pop, coffee and iced tea. Well, they keep all the cans of pop in a clear refrigerator so you can pick what you want, and one of the employees was sitting on the counter blocking my view, and when she saw I was struggling to see she rolled her eyes and then moved. I'd like to add that I'm sure she is a nice enough girl but someone with her temperament should probably work in a job where she doesn't need to interact with people. She was cold and unfriendly. Also, if you ever eaten there you know its fairly small...  I literally heard the host say the f word at least 3 times, and make comments about how bored he was. In my opinion that is totally unacceptable. The pizza was good, but not enough to make me go back. In conclusion if your customer service expectations exceed what you would expect at McDonalds don't waste your time here.
this place is pretty cheap fast the pizza is pretty good too its nothing special but dependable type of taste if that makes sense....
best pizza on the north side I'm loving it.
I miss this place .l worked  for pizza capri when they first opened in summer of 1990 simply the best I miss everything they serve.

I figured this would be just another chain, quick eat Italian joint. I was surprisingly impressed by the food. There is zero ambiance so it's a great place to pick up food to take somewhere else or get delivery. It has all of your typical pizza and pasta dishes, but the Bolognese was really a very hearty, saucy dish. I had meaty, flavorful wings from here as well. The calamari was just so-so, as I guessed it might be. Don't expect gourmet, but the quick eats do the trick.
Loved the food and service.  There chopped avocado chicken salad is off the charts.

Awesome local place for lunch or dinner. Friendly full service staff that calls me by name.  Professional, quick, great food and delicious coffee. Would definitely reccomend stopping in or ordering delivery!!
Not the best pizza in Chicago, there are a lot of better options in the neighborhood, However the rigatoni is top notch. The sauce that comes with it is spot on. Get that instead of the pizza

A little gem in Lincoln park.  The food is freshly made from scratch every day.  Many healthy options like minestrone soup and a large selection of salads.   Online ordering is easy and allows alot of customization.  It's not much to eat in, but it is newly remodeled, clean and well lit.  Fast service with a smile every time.  I order from here a couple times a week.  Pizzas are very good also.
